User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Hey Manito! application.

firebaseUid.description: The Firebase UID associated with the user's authentication.

createdAt.description: The date and time the user account was created.

Plan.title: Plan
Plan.description: Represents a subscription plan for the Hey Manito! application.

name.description: The name of the plan (e.g., Basic, Premium).

credits.description: The number of credits included in the plan. 1 credit = 1000 messages.

description.description: A description of the plan's features and benefits.

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Represents a user's subscription to a specific plan.

status.description: The status of the subscription (e.g., active, cancelled).

Assistant.title: Assistant
Assistant.description: Represents a WhatsApp bot assistant managed within the Hey Manito! application.

description.description: A description of the assistant's purpose.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with the WhatsApp bot.

createdAt.description: The date and time the assistant was created.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to be secure, scalable, and easily debuggable, following the core design principles and strategy mandates. It uses path-based ownership for user-specific data, ensuring authorization independence and simple security rules. The structure promotes clarity, predictability, and consistency.

**Authorization Independence:**

*   User-owned data (assistants, subscriptions) are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, making ownership explicit and avoiding the need for `get()` calls in security rules to verify ownership.

**Structural Segregation:**

*   Each top-level collection (`users`, `plans`) contains documents with the same security posture. This simplifies rules and makes them easier to understand and maintain.

**Access Modeling:**

*   **Private Data:** Path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/assistants/{assistantId}`) is used for user-owned data, which is the preferred approach for private data.

**QAPs Support:**

*   The design supports secure `list` operations because authorization is based on the path and the `request.auth.uid`, so rules don't act as filters.

**Invariants:**

*   The path-based ownership structure ensures the integrity of ownership. Timestamps (createdAt, startDate, endDate) can be enforced via security rules to maintain data consistency.
